body_html:
Asim, thank you for your reply. I asked in StackOverflow but no one responses me yet and I am in a hurry in this issue.

To be simple, the issue is that the normal Back-Propagation should include convolution, differentiate, derivate and other operations to calculate a gradient. However, in TensorFlow, it only uses tensor contraction (for Conv2DBackpropFilter) and matrix transposition(for Conv2DBackpropInput) to do the Back-Propagation. How can it be?

body:
Asim, thank you for your reply. I asked in StackOverflow but no one responses me yet and I am in a hurry in this issue.

To be simple, the issue is that the normal Back-Propagation should include convolution, differentiate,  derivate and other operations to calculate a gradient. However, in TensorFlow, it only uses tensor contraction (for Conv2DBackpropFilter) and matrix transposition(for Conv2DBackpropInput) to do the Back-Propagation. How can it be?
